div.l: And bare yt soft vnto his beddis feet
Sone aftyr the wyfe hir routyng leet
And gan awake and went hir out to pisse
And come agayn ⁊and gan hir cradil mysse
And gropid heer and ther but she fand non̄
Allas quoth she I haue al mysgon
I had almost gon to the clerkis bed
Ey benedicite than had I foule sped
And forth she gos til she the cradil founde
She gropith alway forther with her honde
And fand the bed and thought not but good
By cause that the cradil by yt stood
And nyst not where she was for yt was derk
But fayre and wel she crept in to the clerk
And lyggith ful stille and wold haue take a sleep̄e
Within a lytil this Iohn þis clerk vp leep̄e
And on this good wyfe he layth on sore
So mery a fytte had not she ful yore
He pryked hard and deepe as he were mad
This ioly lyfe haue thise two clerkys lad
Til the thrydde cok began to syng
Aleyn was wery in the dawnyng
For he had swonkyn al the long nyght
And said fare wel malyn my sweet wight
The day is comyn I may lenger byde
But euyr more where so I go or ryde
I am thyn owne clerk so haue I seel
Now deere lemman quoth she go fare wel
But or thou go one thing I wil the telle
Whan thou gost homward by the melle
Right at the entre of the doore behynde
Thou shalt a cake of half a busshel fynde
The which was made of thyn owne mele
Such as I help my syre to stele
And good lemman god the saue ⁊and kepe
And with that wurd she began to wepe
Aleyn vp ryseth and thought or yt were daw
I wil go crepe in by my felaw
And fond the cradil with his hand a non̄
Be god thought he al wrong haue I gon̄
My hed is toty of my swynk to nyght
That makys me that I go not aright
I wot wel by the cradil thatthat I haue mysgo
Here lyggith the mylner and his wyfe also
And forth he goth on twenty deuyl way
Vnto the bedde ther as the myllere lay
He wend haue cropyn in by Iohan
And by the myller he crept anon̄
And caught hym by necke and soft he spak
And said thou Iohan thou swyneshed awak
For crystes soule and here a noble game
For by the lord that callid Seynt Iame
I haue thryes in this short nyght
Swyuyd the myln̉er doughtir bolt vp right
Whils thou hast as a coward been agast
~ Thou fals harlot quoth þe mylner in hast
A fals traytoᵘur fals clerk seid he ·
Thou shal be ded by goddis dignyte
Who durst be so bold to disꝑparage
My doughtyr that is comyn of such lynage
And by the throte boldly he caught aleyn
And he hent hym dispitously ageyn
And on the nose he smot hym with his fist
Doun̄ ran the bloody strem on his bryst
And in the floore with mouth ⁊and nose so broke
Thei walwid as to pigges in a poke
And vp thei gon and doun̄ ageyn a non
Til that the myllere spornyd on a ston
And doun̄ he fel bakward on his wyfe
That wist no thing of this nyse stryfe
For she was fallyn on sleep a lytel wight
With Iohan the clerk that wakid had al nyght
And the fal out of hir sleep she brayd
Help holy crosse of bromholm she said
In manus tuas lord to the I calle
Awake symond the fend is on vs falle
Myn hert is brokyn help I am but ded
Ther lyggith vppon my wombe ⁊and on my hed
Help symkyn for the fals clerkis fight
This Iohn stirt vp als fast as he myght
And gropid by the wallys to · and fro
To fynd a staffe and she styrt vp also
And knew the estres bettyr than did Iohn
By the wal a staffe she fond anon
And saugh a lytil glymeryng of the light
For at an hoole yt shon the mone bright
And by the light she saugh hem bothe two
But sykirly she ne wist who was who
But as she saugh a whyte thing in hir eye
And whan she gan the white thing espye
She wend the clerk had weryd a voluper ·
And with the staff she drough ay neer ⁊and neer
